column1: apoc.date.add(12345, 'ms', -365, 'd') - given a timestamp in one time unit, adds a value of the specified time unit
apoc.date.convert(12345, 'ms', 'd') - convert a timestamp in one time unit into one of a different time unit
apoc.date.convertFormat('Tue, 14 May 2019 14:52:06 -0400', 'rfc_1123_date_time', 'iso_date_time') - convert a String of one date format into a String of another date format.

apoc.date.currentTimestamp() - returns System.currentTimeMillis() at the time it was called. The value is current throughout transaction execution, and is different from Cypher’s timestamp() function, which does not update within a transaction.
apoc.date.fields('2012-12-23',('yyyy-MM-dd')) - return columns and a map representation of date parsed with the given format with entries for years,months,weekdays,days,hours,minutes,seconds,zoneid

column5: d'),('yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss zzz'),('TZ')) - get string representation of time value optionally using the specified unit (default ms) using specified format (default ISO) and specified time zone (default current TZ)

column1: apoc.date.fromISO8601('yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.SSSZ') - return number representation of time in EPOCH format

column5: d','yyyy-MM-dd') - parse date string using the specified format into the specified time unit

column1: apoc.date.systemTimezone() - returns the system timezone display name

column5: d') - return string representation of time in ISO8601 format

column1: toYears(timestamp) or toYears(date[,format]) - converts timestamp into floating point years
